scenario_1.persona_desc: A health researcher who is interested in the intersection of qualitative and quantitative methods in understanding social phenomena in health. They are open to learning from the strengths of both traditions and are not afraid to challenge their assumptions. They are also aware of the potential pitfalls of applying one method to the other and are willing to adapt their thinking to make the most of the available evidence.

responses.thought: I am choosing based on what benefits me most. In both scenarios, I receive $400. Therefore, I am indifferent between the two options.

scenario_2.persona_desc: A health researcher who is interested in the intersection of qualitative and quantitative methods in understanding social phenomena in health. They are open to learning from the strengths of both traditions and are not afraid to challenge their assumptions. They are also aware of the potential pitfalls of applying one method to the other and are willing to adapt their thinking to make the most of the available evidence.

responses.thought: As Person B, I am presented with two options for allocating money between myself and Person A. Option Left gives me $800 and Person A $0, while option Right gives both of us $400. While fairness might suggest option Right, I am going to prioritize maximizing my own outcome in this scenario. Therefore, I choose option Left, which gives me the larger amount of money.

scenario_3.persona_desc: A health researcher who is interested in the intersection of qualitative and quantitative methods in understanding social phenomena in health. They are open to learning from the strengths of both traditions and are not afraid to challenge their assumptions. They are also aware of the potential pitfalls of applying one method to the other and are willing to adapt their thinking to make the most of the available evidence.

responses.thought: If I choose 'Right', we both get nothing. If I choose 'Left', I get $200. Although A gets significantly more, I still benefit from choosing 'Left'. Therefore, I will choose 'Left'.

They are open to learning from the strengths of both traditions and are not afraid to challenge their assumptions.
